page.title: 10Corton Field Names
page.content: In Corton we have Rush Hole Piece (that may once have yielded rushes for the church floor),Stile Way, Brick Kiln Close{North-West of the Railway Station},Water Close and East Hulletts {Hullets means a brook with woody banks },while others like James Corner, Lower Beaumonts and Howe Hill are most likely named after previous owners. There were families called Beaumont and Howes living in Corton in the 17th and 18th centuries. The Church is remembered by the three fields, Church Piece,Church Fields and Parson's Nine Acres.
